qas.question: In what year were the Pashtuns defeated and driven out of Iran?
Who drove out the Pashtuns from Iran in 1729?
Nader Shah expanded Iranian power to its highest peak since what Empire?
Nader Shah took back what territories that were annexed by the Ottomans and the Russians?

context: In <a0_0>1729<a0_0/>, <a1_0>Nader Shah<a1_0/>, a chieftain and military genius from <a2_0>Khorasan<a2_0/>, successfully drove out and conquered the Pashtun invaders. He subsequently took back the annexed <a4_0>Caucasian territories<a4_0/> which were divided among the Ottoman and Russian authorities by the ongoing chaos in Iran. During the reign of Nader Shah, Iran reached its greatest extent since <a3_0>the Sassanid Empire<a3_0/>, reestablishing the Iranian hegemony all over the Caucasus, as well as other major parts of the west and central Asia, and briefly possessing what was arguably the most powerful empire at the time.
